A magnificent dining and reception room stretches across the width of the building, its tall windows drawing in light from the square and amplifying the sense of space. Period proportions remain intact, while the interiors have been sensitively reimagined for modern living. Adjacent, a contemporary kitchen and breakfast room is finished with chic cabinetry and integrated appliances, designed for both everyday ease and larger gatherings. A quiet study sits next door, providing a discreet space for work or reading. <PARA> On this level lies the principal bedroom, an impressive room with deep bay windows and a hotel-like atmosphere. It is served by a smart ensuite bathroom and excellent storage. A staircase leads down to the garden floor, where two further double bedrooms unfold with equally generous dimensions. Bedroom two is particularly striking, opening directly onto the private terrace through elegant French doors. A walk-in wardrobe and well-appointed bathroom complete this floor, alongside practical storage and access to the courtyard beyond. <PARA> Outside, the apartment enjoys a substantial private terrace and garden, an increasingly rare asset in central London. Residents may also apply for access to the celebrated communal gardens of Cadogan Square, among the most beautiful and established in the capital. <PARA> Cadogan Square sits at the heart of Knightsbridge, moments from the boutiques of Sloane Street and the village atmosphere of Pavilion Road. The museums of South Kensington, the greenery of Hyde Park and the cafés of Chelsea are all within easy reach, while excellent transport links connect effortlessly to the West End and beyond. It is a location that balances quiet residential grace with the very best of London on the doorstep.

There are two further rear aspect double bedrooms to this floor and a family bathroom fitted with a bath with shower over. <PARA> Another turning staircase leads to the top floor with two additional double bedrooms (one with limited head height and one with extensive eaves cupboards). There is also a walk in airing cupboard and shower room with walk-in shower to this floor. <PARA> OUTSIDE SPACE: <PARA> A hardstanding drive provides off street parking for a couple of vehicles. An inclined flagstone path leads to the front, with planted beds. Gated access at the side leads to the rear. <PARA> The rear garden has a southwesterly orientation. A flagstone patio is adjacent, with sleeper steps leading up to a gently sloping garden laid to lawn. The garden is fully enclosed by timber fencing. A fully insulated outbuilding and garden shed sits at the top of the garden. The studio has light, power and is wired for internet, and works ideally as a home office. <PARA> ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: <PARA> South Oxfordshire District Council. Tax band F.
